mlp

Class Lexicon

  • java.lang.Object
    • mlp.Lexicon

  • public class Lexicon
extends java.lang.Object
    Models a lexicon, where each entry is a (key,value) pair. A key is a string which can be a Latex command/macro, an alphabetic/alphanumeric symbol (including single Latin letters), or a non-alphanumeric symbol/string. The value part of an entry is a list of alternative FeatureSet objects.

      • hasEntry

        public boolean hasEntry(java.lang.String term)
        Checks whether or not the specified term has an entry in the lexicon.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if the specified term has an entry in the lexicon; otherwise, it returns false.

      • getFeatureSets

        public java.util.List<FeatureSet> getFeatureSets(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the lexicon entry for the specified term.
        Parameters:
        name - the entry name for which the corresponding Feature Sets in the underlying lexicon are to be returned
        Returns:
        the List of FeatureSet objects corresponding to the specified entry name in the underlying lexicon, or null if the lexicon does not contain the specified entry.

      • addEntry

        public void addEntry(java.lang.String term,
                     java.util.List<FeatureSet> featureSets)
        If the specified term has no entry in the lexicon, this method adds a new entry for that term with the specified list of feature sets. If, however, an entry for the specified term already exists, then the exiting list of feature sets is augmented with the specified list if feature sets. No effort is made to eliminate redundancy or inconsistency of feature sets.
        Parameters:
        term - the term for which a Lexicon entry is created or augmented
        featureSets - the list of Feature Sets to be added to the term.

      • setEntry

        public void setEntry(java.lang.String term,
                     java.util.List<FeatureSet> featureSets)
        Associates the specified list of Feature Sets with the specified term. If the lexicon previously contained an entry for the specified term, that list of feature Sets is replaced by the specified list of Feature Sets.
        Parameters:
        term - the term for which a Lexicon entry is set
        featureSets - the list of Feature Sets now associated with the specified entry.

      • findMatchingEntries

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> findMatchingEntries(FeatureSet... fs)
        Returns a list of entry-names that have FeatureSets containing all the specified FeatureSet objects.
        Parameters:
        fs - one or more FeatureSet objects that must be contained in the FeatureSets of the matching entries
        Returns:
        a list of the matching entry-names

      • merge

        public void merge(Lexicon... lex)
        Merges the specified lexicons to the underlying lexicon. If a term is a key in several lexicons, then their corresponding lists of feature sets are simply combined. No effort at eliminating feature-set redundancy or inconsistency is made.
        Parameters:
        lex - zero or more lexicons that are merged to the underlying lexicon.

      • outputLexicon

        public void outputLexicon(java.lang.String symbolMarker,
                          java.lang.String featureSetMarker,
                          java.lang.String outfile)
        Outputs (into a file or onto the screen) the underlying lexicon map. Each lexicon entry is preceded by the specified symbolMarker, and each feature set is preceded in a separate line by the specified featureSetMarker.
        Parameters:
        symbolMarker - a string that is put right before each lexicon entry name in the output file
        featureSetMarker - a string that is put on a separate line preceding each featureSet object
        outfile - the file in which the lexicon map will be stored. If null or empty, the output is printed on the screen.

      • outputLexicon

        public void outputLexicon(java.lang.String symbolMarker,
                          java.lang.String featureSetMarker,
                          java.lang.String outfile,
                          java.util.List<java.lang.String> orderedKeys,
                          java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> oldToNewFeatureNames,
                          java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> oldToNewFeatureSetNames)
        Outputs (into a file or onto the screen) the underlying lexicon map. Each lexicon entry is preceded by the specified symbolMarker, and each feature set is preceded on a separate line by the specified featureSetMarker. The order of the output entries is determine by the specified "orderedKeys", and the names of the features and/or Feature Sets can be modified as specified.
        Parameters:
        symbolMarker - a string that is right before each lexicon entry name in the output file
        featureSetMarker - a string that is put on a separate line preceding each Feature-Set object
        outfile - the file in which the lexicon map will be stored. If null or empty, the output is printed on the screen.
        orderedKeys - a list (of entry-keys) according to whose order the entries of the specified lexicon will be output. If it is null or empty, then the lexicon is printed according to its own internal order.
        oldToNewFeatureNames - a map whose keys are the feature-names to be changed, and the corresponding values are the new feature-names of those features. If it is null or empty, no changes are made to the feature names.
        oldToNewFeatureSetNames - a map whose keys are the Feature-Set names to be changed, and the corresponding values are the new names of those Feature-Sets. If it is null or empty, no changes are made to the feature-set names.
